description.@en:
The way I see it, people are divided into two types: the haves and the have-nots. I know that having nothing liberates me and allows me to look for freedom while those other folks sit miserably in their ivory towers. I’m not a layabout or a tatterdemalion; if anything, I’m more dynamic than most. I’m not tied down by anyone or anything, leaving me free to do what I want and go where I please. The world is a cruel place, and life is hard, but with the wind at my back and satchel on my hip, I can’t help but feel I took the best path.

My ramblings have led me to many places, whether I’m working for a meal or holding down a labor job for a few months. I’ve seen and heard a lot, and some of it scares me. Sometimes when I’m at my campsite warming my supper, I hear things in the dark that don’t sound like any animal I’ve ever heard. I’ve heard rumors all throughout the country of dark things, and it’s always the same story: out there, just beyond our vision, something is shifting and stirring. What it is exactly, I’m not sure, but I’ll bet my last pence it’s nothing good.
